content: I arrived in Canada on 26th August. As per my arrival date, today (i.e. 9th September) is my 14th day of self isolation. But the ArriveCan notification mentions today's reporting as 'Day 12' which is incorrect. Request to please help in correcting the days in the notifications. Thank you.

This app needs major improvement. Yes, it saves time from filling out another form. However, please note that at the airport, you need to save/show the code it generates after you have submitted your details. The customs officers need to see and log the code from this app. So make sure u take a screenshot of it. Other than that, we are requested to update our symptoms daily but the app doesn't allow to 'submit' the response. The 'next' button is always inactive so it's really useless.

I planned my trip a month in advance but the app wouldn't allow me to enter the info until 2 weeks before my trip. Then the border officials at the border crossing I used had no interest in seeing this information. They instead wanted to see the paper that i had typed up with the same information. When I got to day 10 of quarantine the app started opening with a completely black screen so I could no longer record my symptom check in.

Me and my partner indicated that we have an appropriate accommodation for quarantine but after filling everything out they gave us our entry codes with a notice saying "No accommodation for quarantine"... This is quite stressful...
replyContent: Hi Safia. We are very sorry for the inconvenience. Our team is working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. If you continue to experience difficulties, please know that you will be provided the option at the border to fill out the paper version of the form. Please reach out if you have any questions or concerns, phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: I'm glad this App is available but it doesn't fully work. We were able to submit our arrival information without issue and we were able to update it as it changed. But, we haven't been able to report symptoms as per email requests on either the app or the web app for the last 5 days now. Nothing shows up when bell is clicked. We can only redo the arrival information (which asks about symptoms but we can't select arrival earlier than 48hrs) and the quarantine location info on the web app.
replyContent: Hello, to report your symptoms you can click the small bell icon in the top right corner of the app. Also note that symptom reporting post border is voluntary at this time. Please email us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information so that we can investigate further. Thank you so much!

content: App seems to work okay however the associated arrival process is flawed. I am a pilot and use Nexus. I use Nexus to avoid standing in line-ups (well, at least one, still have 2 more lines before exit! - got to love government bureaucracy), however if using the app, you are required to stand in the line (which normally I get to bypass using Nexus) to get a 3 digit code of the day to show the officer at the 2nd line-up. Very redundant as the app shows that it has registered your arrival and gives a code. Not worth it! I will just continue to fill out the form and hand it in at the 2nd line-up.
replyContent: Hello! We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. This feedback is very useful and we will certainly discuss ways to address this. Apologies again and please don't hesitate to reach out to us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca if you have any more questions or concerns.

content: The app says passwords must include a numeric digit but numeric digits are rejected by the app? I cannot create an account?
replyContent: Can you give us more information at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca so that we can investigate.? Please provide us with the make of your mobile device, and version of the app.

content: The ArriveCAN app is very user friendly and convenient (saves having to fill out the paper form). However I had to fill out my information three times because it kept glitching and not keeping my information and/or code. This is stressful because you begin to worry that the app isn't going to work. Once the glitches are worked out the app overall would be good
replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. We are truly sorry for the inconvenience. Our team is aware of this issue and working to address it as soon as possible so that users can have a smooth experience with the app. If you have time, please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some details about where the app glitched during use.

content: Speeds up the process for sure but only when it works. Often doesn't open just shows a black screen and their top banner. Had to uninstall and reinstall. Now it won't let me go to the form to set my arrival, just directs me up the info pages that connect to external website pages. If y'all need some developer help, I know a good group of people. This is an important app and shouldn't be so glitchy. Ya just uninstalled and reinstalled again, form application doesn't show up. Boo. Fix it!
replyContent: That doesn't sound right! Can you give us more information at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca so that we can investigate.

content: Nice, but in the exempt travel, there is no option for students. Some students traveling to Canada are also exempt from travel restrictions like those who have lab courses and so on. Please fix it.
replyContent: Hello, students are not exempt from the 14 day quarantine. Therefore, you should select NO when answering the question if your travel is exempt. Any further questions, please email us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: I have filled all required info and received token. Now whenever I'm trying to enter quarantine daily report I don't have the option. The top right corner bell opens blank page. On the airplane I've filled the form that was collected at my entry point. The immigration officer advise about the app so I've installed on my phone but no reporting option available. WHY?
replyContent: You should receive a push-notification on the app that leads you to the symptom self-assessment function, usually between 24-48 hours after arrival. You can also visit https://arrivecan.cbsa-asfc.cloud-nuage.canada.ca or call 1-833-641-0343 to report symptoms. Please note, symptom reporting is still voluntary at this time.

content: Did all. Needed to change arrival time and lost most info
replyContent: Hello! We are working to improve editing capabilities in the app. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and we really appreciate your feedback. Please rest assured that your new information with your new arrival time will be saved. All the best.

content: The app is perfect. But I'm assuming that a returning permanent resident needs to select answer NO under are you exempt from travelling. Also I didn't get the option of e token number as seen on various videos on youtube... Hope it's correct what I have done
replyContent: Hello! The question regarding exemption is not in reference to being exempt from travelling, it is in reference to being exempt from the 14 day quarantine. As a returning permanent resident you would respond NO you are not exempt from quarantine. Also, there is no longer a need for the token - this was required for an older version of the app.

content: This app is HORRIFICALLY bad. 1) no real instructions in the app on how to fill it out 2) buggy and no ability to edit. My partner filled it out and it said incorrectly that there was no place to quarantine/no food available 3) there is no check in process in the app, or perhaps it's just broken. Forcing you to do daily check-ins on the phone. For something that comes with significant monetary costs for failure to comply... You needed to do A LOT better.
replyContent: Our development is currently working to fix this issue. At this time we are advising users to re-submit their form paying close attention to the wording of the buttons rather than the color of them. You can resubmit the form as many times as you would like.

content: Although I checked in within 48 hours of arrival, I was not able to get the correct date in. No other option then to skip the app and make the phone call
replyContent: Hello. We are sincerely sorry for the inconvenience. If you can send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with a screenshot of what you are seeing in the app, that will help us identify a solution for you. Thank you.

content: Excellent

Doesn't work. When putting in appropriate information about accommodation and travel the app flags it as not having any available accommodation and travel from airport. No one working at Pearson uses the app anyways so it feels like it's just for data collection. The app also flags that you are sick when answering 'no symptoms' in the symptoms check-in. You had one job guys!
replyContent: We apologize for the inconvenience. This is a new tech-related issue we are currently working to address.

content: After completing my "profile" - it changed the time of my flight on its own (I assume that the app used my current time zone then converted it? But now my info is incorrect on my submission). Then, after I submitted it, it said it was ok (green check-mark), but when I went back a few seconds later, it changed to red and said I didn't have accomodation or food delivery (which I do!!). Also I had to disconnect my internet in order to open the app (the app kept giving me a black screen)
replyContent: If you need to update the information on your form prior to arriving at the border you can fill out a new form and we will accept the most recent version. If the application is indicating that you do not have accommodations or food delivery available to you when you do, this is a tech issue we are currently working to correct.

content: When you send me a verification code, I expect it to work.
replyContent: Hello, if your verification code is not working, please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca and we can investigate the issue.

content: I'm daily updates, I've been filling, No I don't have symptoms and I got an email saying, as someone who have symptoms, please be careful.. etc etc.. and that someone will call me. What stupid UI. Also- no need to use this app.. they give you a form in the flight which you have to fill. The dates are also wrong in this app.
replyContent: Hello, thank you for taking the time to review the app.  Feedback such as this helps us improve the user experience going forward.

content: I arrived on 27th of Aug with my family in Canada. As per the arrival date today is my 6th day of self isolation. But the ArriveCan notification mentions today's reporting as 4th day which is incorrect. Also after filling up the daily symptom form and submitting the button the message appears that you may have symptoms of covid even if it is submitted as NO in answers. This message should be corrected. So I started reporting telephonically to avoid this discrepancy.
replyContent: Hello, thank you for taking the time to provide us feedback.  We have addressed this with our development team and hope to have it resolved soon.

content: Easy. Quick.
replyContent: Thank you so much for your feedback! We really appreciate it. All the best.

content: The app has some problems. I used it to enter my details, and to confirm that I have suitable accommodation and that it is possible for me to have food/medicine delivered while I self-isolate. After submitting this information and reviewing it, my submission is highlighted in red and it claims I have neither accommodation nor the ability to have deliveries. I cannot present that to CBSA since it contains incorrect and misleading information and is not a reflection of the information I provided.
replyContent: Hello. We are very sorry for your experience. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information and a screenshot of what you are seeing? We will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you so much for your patience.

content: After entering all data and hitting Submit a circle keeps spinning for a good half hour and doesn't submit. Restarted phone and tried again but app goes into a black screen....
replyContent: Hello. We are sincerely sorry that you are experiencing this. Can you please log out, log back in, and then try and resubmit? If you continue to experience the same problem, please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: Filled in the information as required for flight leaving tomorrow. Even though I enter that Yes, I have a place to quarantine for 14 days and yes, I am able to have food or medicine delivered if required, it flags me red and shows me as not having either of those. Guess I'll see what headache that brings me tomorrow.
replyContent: Hi Ang,  Thank you for your feedback.  This is a issue with the app that has been flagged to our developers and will be resolved soon!

content: nice
replyContent: Thank you! We appreciate the support and hope you had a great travel experience into Canada!

content: After new update, my app screen gone black and doesn't display anything. update: I reinstall the app and the issue was resolved!
replyContent: Hello. We are really sorry for the trouble. Can you send us a note at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information? From there, we can troubleshoot and get to the bottom of the issue in an efficient manner. Thank you so much.

content: App keep crashing. Reinstalled it on both of my phones but issue remains the same. Please fix.
replyContent: Hello. We sincerely apologize. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information? Once we learn more about your case, we will work to get this resolved as soon as possible. Thank you and hope to connect with you soon.

content: I just Uninstalled the app and downloaded it again to fix the issue.
replyContent: Hi Michael. Sounds good. If you run into any more problems, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca. Thank you and all the best.

content: App keeps changing to a different Entry Time... I enter the details in Canadian time but the Entry Pass shows the entry as being 5 hours later in British Time. So I'm supposed to enter at 5pm but the pass shows 10pm. Can't wait for what I'm sure will be a problem regarding this during entry.... Response from developer: "This is a bug" FYI, no- one at the border knew about or asked to see the ArriveCan app, not sure if its a scam or just worthless.
replyContent: Hi Keith. We appreciate your feedback and we are actively working to resolve the issue that you raised. We are also continuously trying to improve awareness of the app at the border. Thank you.

content: hello, can you help me with my issue ?! I have already an account in arrive can. but I am totally unable to logging into the account with correct email and password. I tried few time to enter in it but I don't understand why i am not able to log in into it ..
replyContent: Hello. That doesn't sound right. Can you please contact us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca? We will investigate this further and find a solution for you. Thank you!

content: Wont install. Tried 4 times.
replyContent: Hi Richelle. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information? We will contact you to help get this resolved. Thank you so much!

content: Won't load up at all
replyContent: Hi Mike. We are really sorry that this is happening. Can you please send us an email with some details about your phone and information about what part of the app isn't loading? We will work with you to find a solution. Thank you!  phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca

content: Still no way to edit your arrival time or any other info after you submit. Poor app would expect better if its required to be accurate, but since its not ohh well they can deal with it.
replyContent: Hello. We appreciate your feedback. We are continuously working to improve the app, and feedback like this is an extremely important part of that process.

content: Worked well for going through the border. I thought I was also supposed to use it for daily check ins, but I'm not seeing that option, so I hope I'm not missing anything.
replyContent: Hi Jessica. You can use the app for daily symptom check-ins if you'd like. In the top right corner on the main screen of the app, there should be a bell. If you click it, you should see a notification which will take you to a page to report your symptoms. Please send us an email if you experience any issues phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca. Thank you!

content: filled out the questionnaire and still says incomplete file... also doesn't specify if it wants where you enter Canada or where your final destination will be.. I'm entering Canada in Montreal, but my final flight will be Halifax.
replyContent: Hello! You should enter the flight information for the flight that will bring you into Canada (i.e. Montreal). However, your quarantine plan information should reflect the fact that you will be in Halifax. Please send us an email regarding the incomplete file notification at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca. Thank you and hope to hear from you soon.

content: Untenable and illogical from the government to reject the idea of providing GPS coordinates for the quarantine watch, alone in a cabin in the woods, rather than locked up in a city for fourteen days just because you guys expect me to provide a physical address with a postal code?
replyContent: Hello. Sincere apologies. The app only collects addresses, it does not collect GPS coordinates. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: My airline is not on there "flylevel" from Paris Orly.
replyContent:
Hi Simon. We are very sorry about this. Here is what I recommend: 
1. Use "Other" as the airline, 2. Enter the airline name in the field after selecting "Other", 3. If there is no flight number, please leave the default that appears. I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: Seriously, this is the worst. It says you can add travel partners but you can't enter information for them and then there is no way to change what was wrong. We submitted paperwork at the border to correct what was wrong but I'm getting harrased with calls for what was on the app anyways. And they are rude as hell about it too. There is no way to contact support at all either
replyContent: Hello. We sincerely apologize. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca? We will work with you to provide as much support as we can. Thank you so much.

content: Doesn't deserve the low rating it has currently. Airport experience was faster and easier because of the app. Very simple to use. My only request is for them to tell us when we can uninstall it (or if we'll possibly need it days after landing)
replyContent: Hello.Thank you so much for your feedback! We recommend that you keep the app for 14 days after your arrival.  You can use the app to voluntarily report your symptoms during your quarantine.

content: I am going to enter Canada based on work permit owners exemption, but this option is not on the list to select.
replyContent: Hello! Can you send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more information about your case? We will be able to explain the best options via email. Hope to connect with you soon.

content: App is very useful, but its not allowing to submit day wise follow up questionaire. On reaching the page where it asks for if we have the symptoms for the people enrolled, the next button is deactivated so doesnt allow to submit. For new immigrants who mostly would come up with international roaming are still facing issues when officers try to contact them, it would be a good option to put a call feature or notification over the internet to avoid such hassles in this app.
replyContent: Hello! We really appreciate your feedback, thank you. Sincere apologies for the inconveniences. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with a screenshot of what you are seeing? This will help us identify a solution for you. Thank you so much!

content: Just filled out forms in app. Pretty easy. A suggestion is this: where I am doing my quarantine there is no phone available but internet yes. I can be reached using my cell number and internet only on WhatsApp. If there was a small box for " additional information" at the end of each section or at the end of questionnaire in general, that may help. I don't travel for another 10 days so can't comment to the crashes that others have experienced. Thanns
replyContent: Hi Michael! Thank you for your feedback. Input like this can help improve the app and ensure that it is user-friendly for all. I will flag this to my team. If you have any more questions in the meantime, please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: Stopped working
replyContent: Hi David. We are very sorry to hear this. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more details about what isn't working for you? Thank you so much and hope to hear from you soon.

content: So much better than a paper form. Where's my pen?
Blank screen when I open the app. App worked fine to enter arrival details but cannot update anything
replyContent: That doesn't sound right! Can you send us more information at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca so that we can investigate this further? We will get back to you as soon as we can. Thank you very much.

content: Useless, can't report daily symptoms as doc given by CBSA asks me to do
replyContent: A new version of the app was released on Friday for both Android and iPhone devices to address this specific issue. Please try and re-download the most recent version of the app. If you continue to experience the same problem, please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca. Thank you so much!

content: Doesn't even launch properly. Just opens to a black screen and gets stuck there.
replyContent: That doesn't sound right! Can you give us more information at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca so we can investigate this further? We will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you very much.

content: I was unable to change info when I realized I made a mistake and advanced to the next section. Also, I was unable to check in using the app and had to go through the website. Now that my quarantine is more than over, I still get CBSA spam asking me to check in and log any symptoms. My travel data was entered into the app so the system should know that my isolation is complete.
replyContent: Hello. We are very sorry that you continue to receive emails. Please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca and we will do our best to assist. Thank you so much.

content: Doesn't work
replyContent: Hi Elizabeth. We are very sorry that you have experienced some issues with the app. Please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more details about what is not working for you. Thank you so much!

content: Considering no one at the border asked me for this information, the app is more or less useless.
replyContent: Hi Selina. We sincerely apologize for this. We are actively working to enhance awareness of ArriveCan at the border. If you have time, we would greatly appreciate it if you could share your point of entry with us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca. Thank you so much!

content: Do not use this app. "THEY" will be after you....i repeat DO NOT use this app. Thank you

The app worked good for getting across the border but it said I could use it to do the 48 hour check-in and daily symptoms report and there are no options for that. My notifications area is always blank.
replyContent: Hi Kevin. We are very sorry that you are experiencing this. Can you kindly send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more information and the email address that you used to create an account? Thank you so much.

content: Planned a trip in advance by car and put in all relevant details. The system did not save this information and did not tell me that. It seems that the system only issues you with an entry number on the day of arrival which is ridiculous as you would then have to stop on the road to enter the information etc again (the developers forgot that arriving by car is different to flying in). 500 words is not enough to complain about trying to log on once you have arrived to advise daily symptoms
replyContent: Hi George. We are very sorry that you have had a negative experience with the app. Can you please send us some more information about the type of device that you use and what went wrong? We will do our best to address the issue. Thank you so much!  You can reach us here: phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: I traveled back to Canada on 7 August but I am unable to update my information or do a voluntary reporting! Also, I filled in all my information through the app of my arrival, but no one at the airport (Pearson) asked for ArriveCan code, all I was asked for was a paper form. The app needs to be revamped completely.
replyContent: Sincere apologies for the inconvenience. Please ensure that you have the latest version of the app. You should be able to update your symptoms post-border by clicking the bell icon on the Top Right corner of the main screen and then selecting the appropriate notification. Please let us know if you have more questions phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: Just a note: for airports you should list locations as well. I tried to search for "Montreal" in the list before I realized I had to use the airport name ("Pierre-Elliot Trudeau airport").
replyContent: Hello. Thank you for your feedback, it is greatly appreciated. This will be flagged to the appropriate team to help advise future iterations of the app.

content: I could not get past the 2nd question, 'Please indicate the type of Exempt travel you are performing for this trip'. It only allows me to choose from 4 exempt categories. However the Govt of Canada page provides 13 different categories. The app does not allow for 'Family reunification', which is the reason I am exempt from COVID-19 restrictions. So downloading this was really a waste of time. The app should be aligned with the official Government of Canada restriction measures & exemptions.
replyContent: You are exempt from COVID-19 travel restrictions in that you are allowed to travel for family reunification, but you are not exempt from the 14 day quarantine requirement. You will still be required to quarantine for 14 days and therefore should not select that you are exempt. Please let us know if you have questions! phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca

content: Why rooted devices are not allowened to use?
replyContent: Hello! We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Our current security policy prevents us from allowing rooted devices to download the app. However, we are constantly in review of these policies and this restriction may change in the future. We will keep you updated if it does.

content: The form is very straightforward and user friendly but unfortunately it will not let me complete it. I suspect this is because it is 11 days before I travel, but it is not clear. I am unsure if a hotel classes as 'group' accommodation as I will be quarantined within my room Also I am not an exempt traveller (because of my work ) but I can travel to Canada because a close relative has permanent residency, which I cannot record anywhere
replyContent: Hi Tricia. We are very sorry for the obstacles that you have faced while filling out the app. If you send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca we can answer your questions in more detail. Hope to connect with you soon. All the best.

content: The app works for me but I cross every work day for employment purposes and I do not know what exemption category applies to me. I am not a medical worker. There is no explanation as to what the categories mean. A help or info button would be nice.
replyContent: Hello. Thank you very much for your feedback. It is appreciated. If you could send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more information about the type of work you do, this will help us with our Communications efforts for the app. Thank you so much!

content: I've had this app on my phone for a few weeks as required. I'm in the transport industry driving expedite freight. First couple times I had to reinstall after each use. Does not save traveller info for more than a few days. I travelled on Friday back into Canada was off for a few days left on Tuesday came back on Wednesday and I had to redo all my information again. Why set up an account if it doesn't save your direct information that's in your account. Very annoying and time-consuming .
replyContent: Hello. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We greatly appreciate your feedback, and we will work to ensure that user experiences such as this are a priority in future iterations of the app. In the meantime, please ensure that you have the most recent version of the app downloaded on your phone. Thank you so much!

content: The application works well. However, the travel document section does not work for travellers with a child under one year old. Such persons may not have a passport, and one is unable to submit them as a traveller in this application without one. But this shouldn't be the case for persons that young, who officially do not need a passport to travel.
replyContent: Hello. Thank you very much for your feedback. It is fundamental to enhancing and improving the app. We are aware of this limitation and we are looking to address it. Since this is a mandatory field,  you unfortunately won't be able to submit on behalf of your child in advance of the border. You'll need to provide this information at the border.

content: Once you sign up through the app, expect a barrage of daily spammy emails reminding you to submit your Quarantine and Symptoms Information prior to your arrival in Canada, even though you've already done so and your trip is over (or, in my case, never happened).
replyContent: Hi Aston. I am really sorry that you received numerous emails. Can you send us an email with the following information? We would like to know when you received the emails, whether you registered for the app or the website version, and the operating system that you were using at the time. You can reach us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca. Thank you!

content: I'm a student. I got viza before 18 march so I'm eligible for travel in Canada. In this app first step is type of except travel however, in this step dose not mentioned about students except. Please add this point also because, this app is mandatory for travel in Canada.
replyContent: Hi Harsh. As an international student, you may be eligible for travel to Canada provided that you do not have COVID-19 symptoms. However, you are still required to quarantine for 14 days upon your arrival to Canada. As a result, selecting exempt in the app would not be appropriate, because you are not exempt from the quarantine requirement.

content: Hi, I am not able to answer the first question being a COPR holder. My travel is exempt but which option to select out of the 4?
replyContent: Hi Pankitti. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more information about your case? We will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you!

content: I can only do this for the month it is? My flight in in September but it won't let me fill in information for that month. For an app as important as this, you should be able to enter your information for any date
replyContent: Hi Jonathan. That doesn't sound right! Can you send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information and some more details about what is going on? We will get back to you as soon as possible.

content: Good app. Quick. Better than that paper

The app worked fine for me prior to entering the country by land 2020/07/31. If you truly want an accurate arrival time, the user should have the ability to change it. Although at the border, when I told them I had the ArriveCan app confirmation, they were not interested in it at all. So it was a waste of my time even dealing with the app.
replyContent: Hi Bill. We sincerely apologize for the fact that you had a negative experience with the app. I will certainly flag this to my team. If you have time, please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more details about what went wrong, as well as the border that you arrived at.

content: I have no idea why the reviews for this app are so negative. The app seems to be well designed and I had a painless experience filling out the form!
Horrible app that's useless. It worked for checking through the airport but as far as the thing 48 hours later. It doesn't work.
replyContent: Hello. We sincerely apologize for your experience. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with some more details about what happened after the airport? We will do our best to assist. Thank you.

content: I am a US Trucker, I can't download the app on my Android. Please let me know how to get it done.
replyContent: Hi Robert. We are sorry to hear that you are experiencing this. Can you please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca with your contact information? We will do our best to get to the bottom of this.

content: What shall be our travel exemption if my family and I are entering Canada as permanent residents?
replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for your question. Please send us an email at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca so that we can explain in more detail. Looking forward to connecting with you soon.

content: Trying to use the ArriveCAN APP, however it does not have Houlton or Belleville as a port of entry for land based travel. I modified this review because they contacted me and informed me it is Woodstock. Traveling from Bangor Maine to Fredericton, NB for essential services
replyContent: Hello! We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. The border that you are planning to cross is listed as Woodstock in the app, since Woodstock Rd. is the official name of the Canadian border. I hope this helps. I will flag your comment to our team to help advise future iterations of the app.

content: I've used this app for entering Canada on two occasions now, and it has improved dramatically over the months. I've started to get some emails about a health questionnaire from the government - it would be nice if the app could handle this questionnaire too.
replyContent: Hi Stephen! Thank you so much for your feedback, that is great to hear. I will pass along your suggestion to my team for consideration. All the best.

content: Good

content: I missed my flight, how can I remove my old info from the app. Or should I just add the new flight details on top of that? Please let me know, I would really appreciate the response back from you.
replyContent: Hi Bhavin! Thank you for your note. You can actually just add the new travel details to the app and re-submit the form. The ArriveCan app will consider the most recent information that you submit to be the most accurate. I hope this helps!

content: Issues: 1. You cannot undo your answers. 2. It does not clearly define what entry point is. 3. It says to present an agent with your approval number. The app will process the most recent submission. If you have more questions, please don't hesitate to contact us at phac.arrivecan.aspc@canada.ca.

content: Thus application does not work. I am an essential worker and travel to the US everyday, I have filled the application over the last 2 days and the information does not pop up on the CBSA system when we reach the point of entry.
replyContent: We sincerely apologize. When you fill out the app, you should receive a confirmation number. It can later be found under a banner at the top of the main screen that says "View your entry into Canada code." When you arrive at the border to enter Canada and you present your confirmation #, BSOs will also need to verify that your travel is essential.

content: The language in the app says that those exempt from 14 day quarantine are individuals who crossed to perform essential work, but the actual order states that exemption from quarantine should be those performing AND RECEIVING an essential service, e.g. a Canadian resident who travels into Michigan for a specialist appointment should be exempt from quarantine (as long as they didn't stop anywhere else), because they are receiving an essential service. The language on the app should be corrected.
replyContent: Thank you for your comments on ArriveCAN. There is no exemption from quarantine for travellers returning to Canada after receiving medical treatment in the US. The exemption is specifically for a person entering Canada for the purpose of receiving essential medical services or treatments in Canada. This is to help protect Canada from COVID-19.

content: The app is fine, but as of 14/7/20 you still don't need it. You still have to fill in the paper quarantine form whether you've got this app or not. content: So can ANYONE tell me what this token number is?? Says on the app there are signs posted in the airport of what the token number is, and NO ONE know this, not even the custom officers. Money well spent...

content: Are you able to fill these up on behalf of ur family who wouldnt be able to use the app?

content: Useless app, nobody knew anything about it in YVR airport when I arrived June 11th. We will continue to follow-up with staff on the ground to ensure border service officers are well-informed about the app, and to ensure the app meets its objective of making the process easier, faster and safer. The health and safety of Canadians continues to be a top priority. We apologize for the inconvenience.

content: The app itself is OK. But the border officer has absolutely no clue what it was. replyContent: Hi Chintan, thanks for your feedback. We will continue to follow-up with staff on the ground to ensure border service officers are well-informed, and to ensure the app meets its objective of making the process easier and faster. We apologize for the inconvenience.

content: Having had all the usual problems described with this app I discover it is in experimental mode and can only be used in 2 places. This should have been clearly stated at the beginning. A waste of time especially in these stressful days. Ken Anderson

content: What was the point of this? Why is it on the website? Why are signs of it posted in the Vancouver Airport? It's not used for anything. replyContent: Hi Alex, thanks for your feedback. The purpose of the app is to collect information needed to help contain COVID-19. Filling in the app is a replacement for the form on the ground. content: Wasn't informed i would need some mythical token at all by the people at the douglas point of entry, I'm already on the island with no real feasible way to go back, how am i supposed to get the token without going all the way back to the border? This process is clearly not very well thought out if people aren't being given necessary information.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Tokens are currently on display at ports of entry in order for travellers to submit their information. We will continue to follow-up with staff on the ground to ensure this remains visible to travellers. We apologize for the inconvenience.

content: I can't get into this App as there is no other and my arrival airport from the state after a night coming from Mexico is not on the list.
I filled it all out except the "token" at the end. When I got to the border, the personnel knew nothing about it. There was no posting for a token either.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Tokens are currently on display at ports of entry in order for travellers to submit their information. We will continue to follow-up with staff on the ground to ensure this remains visible to travellers. We apologize for the inconvenience.

content: Hi, I have a question, where can I get the token number? Is it posted on columns of entry hall,or is it on the screen of the declaration kiosk? So everyone uses same code? Or It's generated after the electrical declaration ?I can't understand how it works
replyContent: Hi Li, thanks for your question. Once travellers arrive at a point of entry, there will be posted signage indicated the token number for that specific point of entry. Once entered, the app will generate a summary code for travellers to present to the Border Services Officer.

content: Where can I download the paper form, the app is not working in my phone
replyContent: Hi Paula, we apologize for the difficulties you experienced. In the event that the app is not functioning on your device, alternative options are available at ports of entry.

content: Assisting my parent with this form coming back from Taiwan. Very confusing as it will not allow you to proceed if you do not enter departure date. There IS no departure date if she's coming home, who the hell thought of this form?
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, Andy. The departure date refers to the date a traveller is leaving the country of origin. The arrival date refers to the date a traveller enters Canada.

content: filled in form at Vancouver Airport upon arrive but nobody informed me who to give it too. so now trying to register with app but can't select the date of arrival as can only select yesterday's date only. can you fix so I can register
replyContent: Hi, Wei. Thank you for your feedback. Once you've completed the mandatory information and the token number (available at the port of entry), the app will generate a reference number to be presented to the Border Service Agent at the border.

content: I am flying back to Toronto today and was told to download this App...not possible...gets stuck on Waiting for Downloading
replyContent: Hi, Ania. Thanks for your feedback. We would encourage you to use WiFi when downloading the app. In the event that the app is not functioning on your device, alternative options are available at ports of entry.

content: Coming through Montreal from Paris May 16. Info handed out in Paris. Nobody in Montreal seemed to know anything about it. Usual Gov't roll out glitches where right hand utterly unconcious of left hand. No token available at either Montreal or Toronto or finally Winnipeg to complete registration.

I wasn't aware that I needed to download and complete the form via this app until I arrived at the border. I was told to go fill it in after-the-fact but I was not told I needed a token number to complete the form. There are no options to proceed and no information about who to contact in the app. It would be good to have contact information for support listed more prominently in the app as getting closer to someone who can help has now taken me 6 separate phone calls. Now on hold...
replyContent: We apologize for the difficulties you experienced while using the app. Token numbers are posted at the ports of entry. In the event that the app is not functioning on your device, alternative options are available at ports of entry.

content: It is only possible to enter 3 dates, yesterday, today and tomorrow. It has been like that since I downloaded the app. These are the only dates available.
replyContent: Hi Eric, the app should allow you to enter the date of your arrival. We will look into this issue further. Thank you for your feedback.

content: Need your help here. Sorry the one star is for your attention. I am arriving YVR via Sishuan Airlines. However, there is no Sichuan Airlines in the airline options. so I cannot finish it before entering Canada. Please help me out
replyContent: Hello Ian, We are sorry that you experienced this. If you choose "Other" as the option from the Airline drop down you will be presented with an entry field where you can enter the name of the airline. This is available in the version you are using. Please reach out to us again if you continue to have problems and thank you for using this app.

content: We weren't able to use this app on android or iPhone. Spent hours on hold with CBSA and Public health, with both saying the other is responsible for the app. In the end, border services said the system was down and they would call us back, but they never did
replyContent: Hello, thanks for your feedback. ArriveCAN is currently available on both iOS and Android devices. In the event that the app is not functioning on your device, alternative options are available at ports of entry. All inquiries or trouble shooting should be directed to phac.canarrive.aspc@canada.ca to reach the team directly.

content: Very user friendly!
Got to the step is asks for token number after answering all questions . Where can I get this token number where I am supposed to get this done before travelling ?
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Token numbers are not available in advance. Token numbers are available and displayed at the Ports of Entry. After you've filled out your information, return to the app once you've arrived, and enter the token provided to you at the Port of Entry.

content: wants only digits for postal code no alpha characters
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. Alpha characters are accepted in this data entry point - the error may result by trying to include a space in the field. We recently deployed an update on April 29; please also ensure the newest version is installed.

content: What a useless app and waste if time. I thought I be a responsible citizen returning home and downloaded this app from a link on the government page. Westjet is only doing repatriation flights to Toronto yet the app won't select that airport. How frickin stupid can that be?
replyContent: The ArriveCAN mobile app is currently being piloted at two Canadian ports of entry - Douglas border crossing and the Vancouver airport - for this reason, other locations were not yet advertised. Other locations will go live shortly. Until then, other options will be available at the border in order to submit the Traveller Contact Information form.

content: What a useless time wasting app
replyContent: The ArriveCAN mobile app is currently being piloted at the Vancouver airport and Douglas border crossing and will be made available across Canada shortly. The app is intended to help incoming travelers enter information before their arrival in order to reduce wait times and points of contact at the border.

content: It doesn't bring up any land border crossings except one...Douglas Passenger? Waste of time. The travel information says to use this or a "form" but no link to print the form. So what now...wait for an officer at the booth to hand it to you and then sit there filling it out? Please update the app.
replyContent: The ArriveCAN mobile app is currently being piloted at two Canadian ports of entry - Douglas border crossing and the Vancouver airport. Other locations will go live shortly. Until then, other options will be available at the border in order to submit the Traveller Contact Information form.

content: Not working properly. I am coming in to Toronto airport but the app keeps defaulting to Vancouver airport. I installed and reinstalled a few times but same problem. I type in Toronto airport, Pearson, then click on next and nothing happens. I have an Android phone and it has more than enough room for the app.
replyContent: The ArriveCAN mobile app is currently being piloted at two Canadian ports of entry - Douglas border crossing and the Vancouver airport. Other locations will go live shortly. Until then, other options will be available at the border in order to submit the Traveller Contact Information form.

content: Doesnt work. Wont let me select my port of entry, only lists douglas passenger
replyContent: Hello, thank you for your feedback. The ArriveCAN mobile app is currently being piloted at two Canadian ports of entry - Douglas border crossing and Vancouver airport. Other locations will go live shortly. Until then, other options will be available at the border.
